name: Nibble at the end (small add-on)
summary: When you’re near agreement, ask for a small additional benefit with low relational cost to improve the final deal.
goal: Capture extra value at low risk once momentum exists.
counterparty_guidance: Recognize the late add-on and pause before agreeing.
Ask for reciprocity or tie the nibble to a concession.
If it breaks balance, decline and restate the deal.
Keep the closing clean and documented.

when_to_use: Use when you need a structured move to progress the negotiation.
when_not_to_use: Avoid when facts are missing and you need intake/clarification first.

prerequisites.remediation: Fill target/acceptable/walk-away in the Strategy Canvas.

steps.title: Validate context and prerequisites
steps.instruction: Validate prerequisites, restate the intended move, and identify missing info that would improve execution.
steps.notes: If blockers exist, return remediation instead of artifacts.

steps.title: Execute the strategy
steps.instruction: Generate the required artifacts (drafts, packages, checklist) and run critique rubrics before presenting to the user.

branches.label: They cite policy, budget, or fixed constraints

recommended_move.instruction: Acknowledge the constraint and ask what flexibility exists (other issues, timing, structure) before proposing a new trade-off.

branches.risk_notes: Avoid arguing; pivot to constraints and options.

success_criteria: Move is explicit and progresses the negotiation.
Message includes a next step or calibrated question.
failure_modes: Unnecessary disclosure of urgency or bottom line.
do_not_do: Do not reveal your bottom line unless intentionally walking away.

auto_gates.description: Warn or block if explicit bottom line language is present.

ui.card_summary: When you’re near agreement, ask for a small additional benefit with low relational cost to improve the final deal.
